title: BenchmarkSummary
description:
The `BenchmarkSummary` containing all the information of a single benchmark run

This includes produced files, recorded callgrind events, performance regressions ...

benchmark_exe.description: The path to the compiled and executable benchmark file

benchmark_file.description: The path to the benchmark file

callgrind_summary.description: The summary of the callgrind run

details.description: More details describing this benchmark run

id.description: The user provided id of this benchmark

kind.description: Whether this summary describes a library or binary benchmark

module_path.description: The rust path in the form `bench_file::group::bench`

summary_output.description: The destination and kind of the summary file

tool_summaries.description: The summary of other valgrind tool runs

version.description: The version of this format. Only backwards incompatible cause an increase of the version

Baseline.description:
A `Baseline` depending on the [`BaselineKind`] which points to the corresponding path

This baseline is used for comparisons with the new output of valgrind tools.

kind.description: The kind of the `Baseline`, which currently can only be `Old`

path.description: The path to the file which is used to compare against the new output

BaselineKind.description:
The `BaselineKind` describing the baseline

Currently, iai-callgrind can only compare callgrind output with `.old` files.

oneOf.description: Compare new against `*.old` output files

BenchmarkKind.description: The `BenchmarkKind`, differentiating between library and binary benchmarks

oneOf.description: A library benchmark
A binary benchmark

CallgrindRegressionSummary.description: The `CallgrindRegressionSummary` describing a single event based performance regression

diff_pct.description: The difference between new and old in percent

event_kind.description: The [`EventKind`] which is affected by a performance regression

limit.description: The value of the limit which was exceeded to cause a performance regression

new.description: The value of the new benchmark run

old.description: The value of the old benchmark run

CallgrindRunSummary.description: The `CallgrindRunSummary` containing the recorded events, performance regressions of a single callgrind run

baseline.description: If present, the `Baseline` used to compare the new with the old output

command.description: The executed command extracted from Valgrind output

flamegraphs.description: The summaries of possibly created flamegraphs

regression_fail_fast.description: If the regressions were configured to cause the benchmark run to fail immediately or not

summaries.description: The summaries of all callgrind runs

CostsDiff.description:
The `CostsDiff` describes the difference between an single optional `new` and `old` cost as percentage and factor.

There is either a `new` or an `old` value present. Never can both be absent. If both values are present, then there is also a `diff_pct` and `factor` present.

diff_pct.description: The difference between new and old in percent

factor.description: The difference between new and old expressed as a factor

new.description: The value of the new cost

old.description: The value of the old cost

CostsSummary.description: The `CostsSummary` contains all differences for affected [`EventKind`]s

EventKind.description:
All `EventKind`s callgrind produces and additionally some derived events

Depending on the options passed to Callgrind, these are the events that Callgrind can produce. See the [Callgrind documentation](https://valgrind.org/docs/manual/cl-manual.html#cl-manual.options) for details.

oneOf.description: The default event. I cache reads (which equals the number of instructions executed)
The number of system calls done (--collect-systime=yes)
The elapsed time spent in system calls (--collect-systime=yes)
The cpu time spent during system calls (--collect-systime=nsec)
The number of global bus events (--collect-bus=yes)
D Cache reads (which equals the number of memory reads) (--cache-sim=yes)
D Cache writes (which equals the number of memory writes) (--cache-sim=yes)
I1 cache read misses (--cache-sim=yes)
LL cache instruction read misses (--cache-sim=yes)
D1 cache read misses (--cache-sim=yes)
LL cache data read misses (--cache-sim=yes)
D1 cache write misses (--cache-sim=yes)
LL cache data write misses (--cache-sim=yes)
Derived event showing the L1 hits (--cache-sim=yes)
Derived event showing the LL hits (--cache-sim=yes)
Derived event showing the RAM hits (--cache-sim=yes)
Derived event showing the total amount of cache reads and writes (--cache-sim=yes)
Derived event showing estimated CPU cycles (--cache-sim=yes)
Conditional branches executed (--branch-sim=yes)
Conditional branches mispredicted (--branch-sim=yes)
Indirect branches executed (--branch-sim=yes)
Indirect branches mispredicted (--branch-sim=yes)
Dirty miss because of instruction read (--simulate-wb=yes)
Dirty miss because of data read (--simulate-wb=yes)
Dirty miss because of data write (--simulate-wb=yes)
Counter showing bad temporal locality for L1 caches (--cachuse=yes)
Counter showing bad temporal locality for LL caches (--cachuse=yes)
Counter showing bad spatial locality for L1 caches (--cachuse=yes)
Counter showing bad spatial locality for LL caches (--cachuse=yes)

FlamegraphSummary.description:
The `FlamegraphSummary` records all created paths for an [`EventKind`] specific flamegraph

Either the `regular_path`, `old_path` or the `diff_path` are present. Never can all of them be absent.

diff_path.description: If present, the path to the file of the differential flamegraph

old_path.description: If present, the path to the file of the old regular (non-differential) flamegraph

regular_path.description: If present, the path to the file of the regular (non-differential) flamegraph

SummaryFormat.description: The format (json, ...) in which the summary file should be saved or printed

oneOf.description: The format in a space optimal json representation without newlines
The format in pretty printed json

SummaryOutput.description: Manage the summary output file with this `SummaryOutput`

path.description: The path to the destination file of this summary

ToolRunSummary.description:
The `ToolRunSummary` which contains all information about a single tool run process

There's a separate process and therefore `ToolRunSummary` for the parent process and each child process if `--trace-children=yes` was passed as argument to the `Tool`.

baseline.description: If present, the baseline used to compare with the new output of this tool

command.description: The executed command extracted from Valgrind output

pid.description: The pid of the process of the `command`

summary.description: The tool specific summary extracted from Valgrind output

ToolSummary.description: The `ToolSummary` containing all information about a valgrind tool run

log_paths.description: The paths to the `*.log` files. All tools produce at least one log file

out_paths.description: The paths to the `*.out` files. Not all tools produce an output in addition to the log files
